hero.title:
Decentralizing Enterprise
Infrastructure
hero.text:
DataWorks transforms enterprise computing through programmable
infrastructure allocation. Our protocol enables dynamic distribution of
compute resources across enterprise workloads, crypto operations,
and AI processing-all secured through hardware-enforced isolation.

manifesto.title:
Transforming How
Companies Share
Computing Power
manifesto.text:
Dataworks creates a secure marketplace where companies can
share and trade computing resources on demand. Our protocol
handles everything - from resource allocation to security, allowing
enterprises to maximize their infrasturcture efficiency while
maintaining complete control and isolation
manifesto.label: Learn More

technology.title:
Built for
Multiple
Workloads
technology.text:
Our infrastructure seamlessly adapts to different
computing needs, maximizing efficiency through
intelligent resource allocation. Each workload type is
secured through hardware-enforced isolation,
ensuring optimal performance across all operations.
technology.label: Our Technology

banner.title: Join our team
banner.text: Peptone is constantly on the lookout for skilled team members to develop transformative medicines against intrinsically disordered protein targets.
banner.label: Explore Careers at Peptone

yoast_head_json.og_title: Dr. Kamil Tamiola joins Scientific Advisory Board of ELIXIR CZ Consortium
yoast_head_json.author: peptone

@graph.name: Dr. Kamil Tamiola joins Scientific Advisory Board of ELIXIR CZ Consortium

@graph.caption: Kamil Tamiola joins ELIXIR CZ SAB

itemListElement.name: Dr. Kamil Tamiola joins Scientific Advisory Board of ELIXIR CZ Consortium

@graph.name: Peptone
@graph.description: We design small molecules against intrinsically disordered targets using physics and AI.

page_builder.text: Bellinzona, Switzerland – January 6, 2024. We are thrilled to share that Dr. Kamil Tamiola, the founder and CEO of Peptone, has joined the Scientific Advisory Board of ELIXIR CZ, the Czech National Infrastructure for Biological Data. This research infrastructure focused on bioinformatics is dedicated to organizing, storing, sharing, and facilitating the interoperability of life science data for further processing and analysis. ELIXIR CZ is part of the larger European initiative ELIXIR, which coordinates European life science resources.

page_builder.title: Dr. Kamil Tamiola – a member of the ELIXIR CZ Scientific Advisory Board

page_builder.text:
Dr. Kamil Tamiola is the founder and CEO of Peptone, a pioneering company focused on protein engineering and biophysics, leveraging advanced computational methods and artificial intelligence to design and optimize protein therapeutics. His expertise lies in the intersection of structural biophysics, molecular dynamics, and data-driven approaches to understand and manipulate protein behavior. With a strong background in protein dynamics and biopharmaceutical applications, Dr. Tamiola has made significant contributions to integrating computational modeling with experimental workflows.

At Peptone, Dr. Tamiola leads projects that push the boundaries of traditional protein design, creating innovative solutions that are highly relevant to the pharmaceutical and biotech sectors. His work embodies a unique blend of academic research and practical industry impact, showcasing his ability to translate complex scientific concepts into tangible advancements in drug development. This blend of academic rigor and industrial acumen positions him as a strategic figure in driving collaborations and advancements within the European bioinformatics and biotechnology landscapes.

page_builder.title: ELIXIR CZ Scientific Advisory Board

page_builder.text:
Chair: Prof. Carole Anne Goble, University of Manchester

  • Dr. Vladimír Beneš, European Molecular Biology Laboratory

  • Prof. Thomas Rattei, University of Vienna

  • Prof. Dr. Torsten Schwede, University of Basel

  • Dr. Zsuzsanna Dosztányi, Eötvös Loránd University

  • Dr. Vítor Alexandre Pires Martins dos Santos, Wageningen University

  • Dr. Kamil Tamiola, Peptone Ltd

ELIXIR CZ, or the Czech National Infrastructure for Biological Data, is a research infrastructure focused on bioinformatics. It is dedicated to organizing, storing, sharing, and facilitating the interoperability of life science data for further processing and analysis. ELIXIR CZ is part of the broader European initiative, ELIXIR, which coordinates life science resources across Europe. Here are some key aspects of ELIXIR CZ:

  • Consortium: It consists of 14 partner institutions, coordinated by the Institute of Organic Chemistry and Biochemistry of the Czech Academy of Sciences. These partners include various universities, institutes, and e-infrastructures within the Czech Republic.

  • Services: ELIXIR CZ provides a range of services including specialized databases, tools for data analysis, and e-infrastructure services. These resources are made available in an open access format to both national and international life science researchers. Some services require authentication via systems like ELIXIR AAI for access to sensitive data.

  • Focus Areas: The infrastructure aims to address challenges in five strategic areas: Chemical Biology, Genomics, Computing and Data Management, 3D-Bioinformatics, and Precision Medicine.

  • Funding and Projects: ELIXIR CZ operates on project funding both at national and European levels, with significant support from the Ministry of Education, Youth, and Sports of the Czech Republic. Projects often aim to ensure data adheres to the FAIR principles (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable).

  • Education and Training: It also invests in training programs, offering seminars, workshops, and hands-on courses to enhance the effective use of its services.

  • Governance: The infrastructure is governed by a Head of Infrastructure, a Board, and a Scientific Advisory Board, ensuring that its activities align with both national needs and international standards.

This infrastructure plays a crucial role in bridging life science research with IT services, facilitating research across various life science disciplines in the Czech Republic and beyond.

@graph.name: Peptone team presents a new method for estimating the change in stability resulting from point mutations at the NeurIPS 2024 Conference
@graph.description: AI team introduces ProteinMPNN-ddG for estimating protein stability changes from mutations, enhancing speed and efficiency with GPU support.

@graph.caption: Carlo Fisicaro and Michele Invernizzi at NeurIPS 2024 Conference.

itemListElement.name: Peptone team presents a new method for estimating the change in stability resulting from point mutations at the NeurIPS 2024 Conference

@graph.name: Peptone
@graph.description: We design small molecules against intrinsically disordered targets using physics and AI.

page_builder.text:
Our AI team, led by Carlo Fisicaro and Michele Invernizzi, is presenting ProteinMPNN-ddG, a new method for estimating the change in stability resulting from point mutations in both monomeric and multimeric proteins.

We have enhanced ProteinMPNN from the Institute for Protein Design, University of Washington, through an additional term derived from the model itself, where only backbone atoms of the single residue being predicted are given, without sequence or structural context, analogously to standard classical free energy calculations. Additionally, we have introduced a new tied decoding scheme, reducing the time complexity from O(N^2) to O(NlogN) and incorporating a full sequence context.

This speedup enables the identification of mutations affecting protein stability at the proteome scale.

Our implementation, combined with a high-performing parser parallelized on NVIDIA GPUs, makes the package incredibly fast.

related.post_title: Fast and scalable protein stability prediction improvement without additional training or data

related.post_title: Peptone featured in Nature Biotechnology and Drug Discovery
Peptone closes a $40M Series-A funding round led by F-Prime and Bessemer Venture Partners
Peptone opens an advanced experimental biophysics laboratory in Bellinzona

page_builder.text:
We are excited to share that our Chief Executive Officer, Dr. Kamil Tamiola, and our Chief Business Officer, Dr. Benjamin Owens, were featured in an editorial issue titled “Peptone: Finding Opportunity in Disorder” by Michael Eisenstein of Nature Biotechnology.

As noted by Dr Lukasz Kurgan, a bioinformatician at Virginia Commonwealth University, who also contributed to the article,

Disordered proteins are mostly known for their involvement in conditions such as Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s, for which messy clumps of misfolded protein figure prominently in the disease pathology. But in fact, many proteins rely heavily on unstructured elements to execute their normal biological functions and these elements offer a flexible interface for establishing interactions with a range of DNA, RNA or protein targets. “That disordered region can essentially refold depending on the interaction, and that gives it a lot more bang for the buck,” says Kurgan, who has no ties to Peptone. “There’s still specificity there, so it’s not like you can bind to anything, but there’s diversity with that specificity.”

You can access the entire edition of Nature Biotechnology that focuses on Peptone by clicking on the provided link.

About Peptone
Peptone is a translational biophysics company focused on the discovery of novel therapeutics against diseases driven by intrinsically disordered proteins. IDPs are proteins without a fixed structure that play a significant role in health and disease. For more information about Peptone Therapeutics, visit peptone.io.

related.post_title: Peptone sponsors Gordon Research Conference 2024 on Biophysics and Biology of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins
Peptone was selected as one of Nature Biotechnology's top academic spinouts in 2023

page_builder.text:
Summary

Deep-learning protein sequence models have shown outstanding performance at de novo protein design and variant effect prediction.

By introducing a second term derived from the models themselves, we substantially improved performance without further training or additional experimental data. This term aligns outputs for the task of stability prediction.

On a task to predict variants that increase protein stability, the absolute success probabilities of ProteinMPNN and ESMif are improved by 11% and 5%, respectively.

Key findings

We demonstrate that inverse folding models can be significantly improved at protein stability prediction without additional training or data.

image.title: Accuracy of predictions for various models and publicly available protein stability
image.alt: Accuracy of predictions for various models and publicly available protein stability
image.caption: Accuracy of predictions for various models and publicly available protein stability
image.name: img_0206

page_builder.text:
The source of improvement

The improvement in accuracy is achieved through a simple additional term derived from the model itself, where only backbone atoms of the single residue being predicted are given, without sequence or structural context, analogously to standard procedures in classical free energy calculations.

Predicting thousands of residues per second

ProteinMPNN is modified to use full sequence context, and we introduce a novel tied decoding scheme to improve computational efficiency and enable saturation mutagenesis studies at scale.

Citing this work

Improving Inverse Folding models at Protein Stability Prediction without additional Training or Data.
Oliver Dutton, Sandro Bottaro, Michele Invernizzi, Istvan Redl, Albert Chung, Carlo Fisicaro, Fabio Airoldi, Stefano Ruschetta, Louie Henderson, Benjamin M.J. Owens, Patrik Foerch, and Kamil Tamiola.
bioRxiv 2024.06.15.599145; https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.06.15.599145

About Peptone

Peptone is a translational biophysics company focused on the discovery of novel therapeutics against diseases driven by intrinsically disordered proteins. IDPs are proteins without a fixed structure that play a significant role in health and disease.

hero.payoff: Collaboration focused on novel target discovery in prostate cancer.

related.post_title: Peptone Expands Leadership Team with Key Executive Hires
Peptone opens an advanced experimental biophysics laboratory in Bellinzona

page_builder.text:
LONDON, UK and BELLINZONA, Switzerland – Peptone, a leader in translational biophysics and the design of novel therapeutics against intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs), and The Institute of Oncology Research (IOR) today announced the commencement of a collaborative sponsored research agreement in prostate cancer. The collaboration will focus on the identification and progression of novel targets in oncology using translational models to develop innovative medicines for patients suffering from prostate cancer.

“A collaboration with IOR combines Peptone’s strength in targeting disordered proteins using a combination of generative machine learning and unique structural insights into disordered targets using our bespoke HDX-MS technology and patient insights about cancer born out of seminal works of Prof. Alimonti’s group in Bellinzona. Our collaboration is an excellent example of efficient technology transfer process and a growing research and biotech ecosystem in Ticino, Switzerland, said Kamil Tamiola, PhD, CEO of Peptone.”

Peptone is applying advanced biophysics atomic-level experimental approaches, including a novel ultra-low latency hydrogen-deuterium exchange mass spectrometry (HDX-MS), supercomputing and generative AI to interrogate and drug intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs). IDPs are proteins that play a significant role in health and disease but because they lack a fixed structure, have been intractable or undruggable with conventional drug discovery approaches.

“Prostate Cancer remains a highly prevalent disease with significant unmet clinical needs.”, said
Professor Andrea Alimonti, MD, Incoming Director, and Professor of Molecular Oncology at IOR.
“We are delighted to partner with Peptone on this research collaboration focused on novel target
discovery in prostate cancer. Recent findings from my team demonstrate that advanced prostate
cancer is regulated by several intrinsically disordered proteins, many of which can also control
the tumor immune response. Targeting those proteins could be a way to defeat this poorly
curable disease.

About Peptone
Peptone is a translational biophysics company focused on the discovery of novel therapeutics against diseases driven by intrinsically disordered proteins. IDPs are proteins without a fixed structure that play a significant role in health and disease.

About IOR Bellinzona
The Institute of Oncology Research, established in 2003 in Bellinzona (Switzerland), is affiliated with the Università della Svizzera Italiana (USI). It hosts researchers from all over the world performing basic and translational research in oncology with a particular focus on cancer biology, genomics, molecular oncology and experimental therapeutics. The IOR is located in a brand-new high-tech research building that hosts more than 20 different research groups, with state-of-the-art labs and facilities. Together with the Institute for Research in Biomedicine (IRB), the IOR is a member of the Bellinzona Institutes of Science (Bios⁺), a recently established non-
profit association aiming to promote, support and coordinate scientific research and teaching activities of its members.
